bug.short_desc: beets web plugin not provided or not working

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Fedora; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/49.0.2623.110 Safari/537.36 Build Identifier:
When I run the beet web command, it fails to find the web plugin.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. install beets and beets-plugins 2. enable web plug by adding plugins: web to the beets config file (edit by typing beet config -e) 3. try to run the command 'beet web' Actual Results: $ beet -vvvvv web user configuration: /home/gleblanc/.config/beets/config.yaml data directory: /home/gleblanc/.config/beets plugin paths: ** plugin web not found Sending event: pluginload library database: /run/media/gleblanc/BigMomma/Greg/data/musiclibrary.blb library directory: /run/media/gleblanc/BigMomma/Greg/music Sending event: library_opened error: unknown command 'web'
This was on purpose at the time due to missing dependency as noted in the .spec. I will take a look and see if things have changed for f24
beets-1.3.19-3.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-079e146bae

beets-1.3.19-3.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-079e146bae
beets-1.3.19-3.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
